com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface importOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface importOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document importOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The importOrder API is used to import a fully processed order from an external system into the Sterling Selling and fulfillment Suite system for history information purpose.

    • Method Detail

      • importOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document importOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                          throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                 java.rmi.RemoteException

        The importOrder API is used to import a fully processed order from an external system into the Sterling Selling and fulfillment Suite system for history information purpose. This API is meant to be used in place of a SQL data load as it handles the complexities of primary key generation and foreign key posting in the child tables. It has minimal validations and it does not handle payments processing and inventory impact related to the imported order.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:

          Event raised under transaction IMPORT_ORDER.
          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of this API.
            Data published: YFS_IMPORT_ORDER.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Key data: modifyOrder_dbd.txt
            Template Support: Yes. However, some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to xml for element level details.

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:

          If the order is imported into normal tables, the API creates appropriate TaskQueue record(s) based on the Pipeline configuration, provided the correct PipelineKey(s) are provided in the input XML.

        Output Template Support: Yes

          However, some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to the output xml for element level details.

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

          Supported for all the input nodes except PaymentDetails.

        Additional Information:

          Maintain the sequence of the elements in the input XML.

          The API stores PAYMENT_STATUS = PAID for the order, but does not do any validation of PaymentDetails and TotalAmount to determine whether or not the order has actually been paid for.

          For the order, if TotalAmount is not equal to InvoicedAmount , the API creates a charge transaction record with chargetype ='SHIPMENT_ADJUSTMENT' and book_amount = -(TotalAmount - InvoicedAmount)

          For the order, (TotalAmount - ReturnedAmount + TotalAdjustmentAmount) should be equal to sum of ProcessedAmount. Otherwise, payment processing may be triggered. Calculate the total charges and passed in the other charges as(charges - discount).

          If the combination of ChargeName and ChargeCategory (in the elements HeaderCharge, HeaderTax, LineCharge, LineTax) does not exist in the system, then there will be problems in displaying the Charge information on the UI. However, this API does not do any validation in this regard.

          PaymentMethod(s) should satisfy the completeness criteria for the payment type. (Refer to the createOrder API). Otherwise, there may be problems in returns (or other payment processing) due to MissingPaymentInformation. This API will validate that the Payment Type passed is valid for the seller.

          If the system installation rule Encrypt Credit Card Number is configured as Yes, the encryption routine will be called by this API to encrypt CreditCardNos.

          For each Payment Method, TOTAL_AUTHORIZED is set to the sum of OPEN_AUTHORIZED_AMOUNT of ChargeTransaction records (belonging to this Payment Method), with CHARGE_TYPE = AUTHORIZATION.

          For each Payment Method, TOTAL_CHARGED is set to the sum of CREDIT_AMOUNT ( > 0) of ChargeTransaction records (belonging to this Payment Method), with CHARGE_TYPE = CHARGE.

          For each Payment Method, TOTAL_REFUNDED_AMOUNT is set to the sum of CREDIT_AMOUNT ( < 0) of ChargeTransaction (records belonging to this Payment Method), with CHARGE_TYPE = CHARGE

          The STATUS of each yfs_charge_transaction record created by this API is set to CHECKED, so that the record will not be picked up by the Payment agents later.

          No validation is done for OrderLine/DistributionRuleId, but inventory processing can face problems if this is invalid.

          If the Driver Date (ReqDeliveryDate or ReqShipDate) is not passed in the input, it is set to the beginning of the current day. The Dependent Date is calculated from the Driver Date, based on Delivery Lead time.

          Totaling of price is not done by this API. Values of the relevant attributes like TotalAmount, passed in the input XML, are stored in the respective DB columns without validation. If a discrepancy exists between unit prices, unit charges, and total amounts and charges, then there will be mismatch between order amount and return amount.

          Table Keys (= Primary Keys, like OrderHeaderKey), if not passed, will be generated. If passed, they should be unique for the respective tables; otherwise a unique constraint violation will occur.

          InstructionType is defaulted to OTHER if not passed in the input xml.

          To have RequestCollection pick up the imported order for payment processing, change the imported order (change any of the following: price, charges, taxes, payment methods, ordered quantity).

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the order imported by the API. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
